By the way: |method|| RunNotifier.pleaseStop()||||
exists whereas|||||||||||||||||| JUnitCore||.pleaseStop() ||||||
||does not
I Think it should be added.

By the way: if i give a timeout it turns out that the process goes on in
the background until it finishes.
This makes bad performance to the following tests.
But (i'm not so much into it) maybe there is no way to stop the thread
(Thread.stop() is "@deprecated").
On the other hand, starting each testcase in its own thread would be a
way to stop a testcase quickly
rather than asking kindly "||pleaseStop()".
||I'd prefer this because my testcases are sometimes lengthy.



Hope there are some usable thoughts in here.
